articles.title: Paytm dives to record low, wealth destruction for IPO investors tops $10 billion - Moneycontrol.com
articles.description: Thus far in January, shares of the company have nosedived more than 28 percent after brokerage firm Macquarie slashed its price target on the stock to Rs 900 from Rs 1,200 earlier as it sees limited signs of upswing in the company’s business fortunes.
articles.content:
Shares of One97 Communications, the parent of Paytm, slumped to their record low of Rs 952.3 apiece on the National Stock Exchange as investors still remain bearish towards the companys prospects.

articles.author: Seshan Vijayraghvan
articles.title: Porsche India Sells 474 Units In 2021 Witnessing A 62% Growth YoY - carandbike
articles.description: Between January and December 2021, Porsche India sold 474 units in the country, its best-ever sales performance since 2014. Compared to 2020, the German luxury sports car maker witnessed a massive 62 per cent year-on-year growth.
articles.content: Porsche India has released its sales numbers for the 2021 calendar year, and between January and December 2021, the company sold 474 units in the country, its best-ever sales performance since 2014. … [+3025 chars]
